trans-unit.source: Supports a simple iteration over a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.
Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> also brings the enumerator back to this position.
At this position, calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A>.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.
For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.
Gets the current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to Current return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
The current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.
The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
Advances the enumerator to the next element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.
This method advances the enumerator to the next element in the collection.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.
For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.
The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.
An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged.

If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or Reset throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
Gets an object from a collection.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A> return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
The current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref>.
The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
